page.title: 19A DAY IN MY LIFE-HOME LIFE 2
page.content: The final bell of the day rings at 3.30p.m. and we line up ready to catch the bus home. Once at{home}there is time to play, but "Homework" is the order shouted to me as I walk through the door. My sister arrives home from secondary school and does her homework too. Finished at last and free to{play}on the adventure playground or on my B.M.X. bicycle. I am having fun when my sister shouts to say that tea is ready. By now dad is home from work. We sit infront of the T.V. and eat our tea. I go outside to play with my friends again until 7.30. Bathtime arrives, followed by supper and a little television. At 9.30 I clean my teeth and go to bed. The radio alarm is set. One day is over and tomorrow to look forward to. By Paul Brown age 10.
